title: Rahul Dravid

coverImage.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported license.

summary: Rahul Dravid is a former Indian cricketer and captain, widely regarded as one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket.

value.label: Rahul Sharad Dravid
Indore, India
The Wall
Indian
Batsman, wicket-keeper

facts.label: St. Joseph's Boys High School, Bengaluru

image.altText: Image of St. Joseph's Boys High School, Bengaluru

value.label: Rahul Dravid is a right-handed batsman, and also an occasional wicket-keeper

image.altText: Style of play for Rahul Dravid
image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: Dravid made his Ranji Trophy debut in 1991versus Maharashtra.
Dravid made his international debut in 1996 in an ODI against Sri Lanka in the Singer Cup held in Singapore.

The Sri Lanka national cricket team, nicknamed The Lions, represents Sri Lanka in international cricket. It is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One-Day International (ODI) and T20 International (T20I) status.

value.label: Dravid made his World Cup debut against South Africa in 1999 at Hove scoring a half century.

The 1999 Cricket World Cup was the seventh edition of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was hosted primarily by England, with some games being played in Scotland, Ireland, Wales and the Netherlands.

value.label: Dravid was the vice-captain during the 2003 World Cup, playing as a wicket-keeper batsman.
The 2003 Cricket World Cup was the eighth Cricket World Cup, organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was co-hosted by South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.

value.label: Rahul Dravid was appointed the captain for the Indian team for the 2007 World Cup, where India had an unsuccessful campaign.

The 2007 Cricket World Cup (officially known as ICC Cricket World Cup 2007) was the 9th edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament that took place in the West Indies from 13 March to 28 April 2007, using the sport's One Day International (ODI) format.

value.label: Rahul Dravid played for Royal Challengers Bangalore in IPL 2008, 2009 and 2010.

value.label: Dravid scored nearly 25000 runs in international cricket.

image.altText: Dravid scored nearly 25000 runs in international cricket.

value.label: Dravid has scored five double centuries in Test matches

image.altText: Dravid has scored five double centuries in Test matches

value.label: Dravid held the record for the most number of catches taken by a player (non-wicket-keeper) in Test cricket, with 210 catches.

image.altText: Dravid held the record for the most number of catches taken by a player (non-wicket-keeper) in Test cricket, with 210 catches.

value.label: Dravid and VVS Laxman played a 376 run partnership during a test match against Australia, which was won by India by 171 runs.

image.altText: Dravid and VVS Laxman played a 376 run partnership during a test match against Australia, which was won by India by 171 runs.

value.label: Dravid put up a partnership of 331 runs with Tendulkar which was a world record

image.altText: Dravid put up a partnership of 331 runs with Tendulkar which was a world record

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

value.label: The Rajasthan Royals (often abbreviated as RR) are a franchise cricket team based in Jaipur, Rajasthan, that plays in the Indian Premier League.

Arjuna Awards are given by the Government for outstanding achievement in sports
